title: Ocean Centres discuss offshore renewable energy potential
body: A high-level workshop titled Unlocking Bangladesh’s Offshore Renewable Energy Potential: Policy, Innovation, and Sustainable Growth was convened at the Six Seasons Hotel in Dhaka on Wednesday. Organised by Ocean Centres Bangladesh, the event brought together key policymakers, industry leaders, technologists, and academics to strategies on developing the nation’s vast marine renewable energy resources. The workshop was graced by Ashraful Alam, member, Sustainable and Renewable Energy Development Authority, as chief guest. The special guest was Mostafa Al Mahmud, president of the Bangladesh Sustainable and Renewable Energy Association. In his opening remarks, Commodore Mohammad Abdur Razzak (retd), country lead of Ocean Centres Bangladesh, welcomed the participants and outlined the critical role of offshore energy in achieving Bangladesh’s clean energy and blue economy goals. He emphasised the need for collaborative frameworks to transform oceanic potential into tangible power for the national grid. The chief guest, in his speech reaffirmed the government’s commitment to diversifying the energy mix. ‘Our journey towards a sustainable energy future must include the immense power of our seas. SREDA is committed to creating an enabling policy environment to attract investment and foster innovation in offshore wind, solar, and other marine renewable technologies,’ he stated.
